Name: Bēl-udammiq
ind.Name: Bēl-udammiq
Biography: He was married to a daughter of Nabû-ahhē-iddin of the Egibi family.

represented by agent

Name: Kalbāya
ind.Name: Kalbāya
Biography: He was the son of Šumu-ukīn and of the sister of Nabû-ahhē-iddin. Nabû-ahhē-iddin from the Egibi family adopted him, cf. CTMMA 3, no. 53.

Name: Lâbâši
ind.Name: Iddin-Nabû
Biography: For the identification of Lâbâši as this man's second name, see Waerzeggers 2010, p. 562.

Name: Nabû-ēṭir
ind.Name: Nabû-ēṭir
Biography: This person is also attested with the family name Ēṭiru. Cf. Wunsch 2014: "Double Family Names in Neo-Babylonian Records: The Case of the Ēṭiru and Ṭābihu Families and Their Butchers' Perbends", in Zoltán Csabai (ed.), Studies in Economic and Social History of the Ancient Near East in Memory of Péter Vargyas (Ancient Near East and Mediterranian Studies 2), Budapest, 751–787.

Biography: Note that in BM 32205+ his name is consistently spelled Nergal-ušallim(GI), but the family relationships in this document demonstrate it has to be Nergal-ušēzib.
